page.title: 02TRANSPORT IN GT. WAKERING
page.content: THE TYPES OF TRANSPORT THAT EXIST ARE VEHICLES EITHER PULLED BY HORSES SUCH AS CARTS OR MORE COMMONLY VEHICLES POWERED BY ENGINES SUCH AS CARS AND LORRIES. BICYCLES WHICH ARE PEDDLED ARE ALSO VERY POPULAR. THE TRANSPORT WE USE MOST IS THE CAR WHICH IS A FORM OF PRIVATE TRANSPORT BUT SOME PEOPLE USE PUBLIC TRANSPORT WHICH IS LARGE BUSES OR COACHES WHICH STOP AT CERTAIN PLACES ALONG A ROUTE AND PICK UP PASSENGERS. THE OLDER CHILDREN IN THE AREA USE COACHES TO TRANSPORT THEM TO THEIR SCHOOL WHICH IS OUTSIDE OUR AREA. PEOPLE DO NOT WALK VERY MUCH EXCEPT FOR PLEASURE. IF THEY HAVE TO GET ANYWHERE WITHIN THE AREA THEY USUALLY CYCLE OR DRIVE A CAR AND IF THEY WANT TO GO OUTSIDE THE AREA THEY WOULD EITHER DRIVE THE CAR OR WAIT FOR A BUS AT A BUS STOP. THERE ARE 7 BUS ROUTES IN OUR AREA.
